The four had been out somewhere and were now coming back to the house. Both girls needed to use the bathroom, and Kate got to the downstairs one first, so Mary had to go upstairs. After using the bathroom, Mary noticed a box on her cousin Ryan's bed as she passed it. The box caught her interest for whatever reason, so she headed into Ryan's room to take a peek. She first noticed the remote lying on the bed, and then noticed the instruction manual. Curious, she picked it up and read through it.

"Wow, this can't be real, can it?" Mary asked herself. "But maybe it would be a good idea to try it? If it does work, I should have this instead of Ryan."

Mary picked the remote up off of her older cousin's bed and then headed to the window to look for targets. Spotting two teenage girls -- a blonde wearing a short denim skirt and an off-the-shoulder top and a brunette wearing a tank top and skinny jeans -- Mary targeted them with a Clothes swap. A bright light shot out from the remote, temporarily blinding Mary. When her vision cleared, the 13 year old let out a surprised gasp. Looking down at the two older girls she saw that their clothes had switched!

"I can't believe this works!" she exclaimed. "I hope Ryan doesn't get mad at me for taking it."

And with that, Mary claimed the remote as her own. Now the question was what to do next.

"Yeah, we can really mess with her," Ryan said. "She deserves it."

Mary pressed the button again, and then there was a flash of light. When his vision cleared, Ryan noticed that nothing seemed to be different, except Mary now had a confused look on her face.

Before Mary could reply, Ashley suddenly ran over and pushed her aside. "Sorry, Mary. I need to talk to my brother for a sec," she said before grabbing Ryan and dragging him (and the remote) out of the room.

"I think so," Mary said in Ashley's body. "And now I'm her." She then felt up her new, older body, clad in a pair of short jean shorts and a skimpy purple tank top. "And that makes me your older sister," she continued, laughing.

"Sure, why not?" the new Ashley said. "There's no downside. Ashley was awful and I wanted to be older, and I'm older and she's not around."

info.brief_description: Ryan finds a remote that can swap people's bodies and more. Additions encouraged!
info.description:
One day, a package is delivered to Ryan's house and is addressed to him. Inside he finds a remote with several functions:

Body Swap: swaps the bodies of the targets. Targets keep their own clothes.
Body Swap with Clothes: swaps the bodies and clothes of the targets. (this includes tattoos, makeup, piercings, and hairstyles)
Body and Life Swap: targets will swap bodies and think they are each other.
Clothes Swap: targets will swap clothes (this includes tattoos, makeup, piercings, and hairstyles)
Personality Swap: targets will swap personalities. This will also swap toys and posters and other such personality related possessions.
Undo: undoes the last swap
Reset: puts everything back to normal

Only the people holding the remote during the swap will think anything is different. The one exception is that if someone is aware of a particular swap, if the Reset or Undo buttons are used to undo that swap, they will still be aware of it being reset even if they are not holding the remote. Things would get complicated if this wasn't the case.

The remote will always travel with the user to prevent losing the remote or having it stolen by a swapee.

The remote does not work on pictures, videos, etc., only on real people.

There is some room for interpretation on how some of the buttons work in specific situations, namely Personality Swap and Body and Life Swap, but please keep it consistent in a story branch once it's established how they work in that branch.

This story stands on its own, but it is also the first part in a series of loosely related interactive stories that share the same universe.

Rules:
No killing characters

No abruptly ending the story. If you want to end it, go ahead, but please build up to it and try not to have it too early.

No adding remote powers

Keep with the continuity of the story branch. For example, I leave minor character descriptions up to you, but please keep them consistent in each branch.

Keep the story in 3rd Person PoV. That means he, his, etc. not I, me, or you. I have nothing wrong with writing in 1st or 2nd person but I like to keep things consistent. If you do happen to not follow this rule I will fix your chapter. You've been warned so don't freak out if I do it. As for PoV, as long as Ryan has the remote you must follow him, if he somehow looses it or gives it to someone else, you can either follow the new remote carrier or follow Ryan as he tries to get it back. In some cases you can follow other characters for a while as they explore changes as long as you come back to Ryan at some point.

Please use good spelling and grammar. This is my biggest pet peeve (yes I'm a huge Grammar Nazi ). If you make a small mistake, I will fix it, but if your chapter is impossibly illegible, I will delete it because I will not waste my time trying to figure out what you wrote and then fixing it.

Other than that, feel free to do almost anything. You can add whatever other characters you want; neighbors, friends, enemies, acquaintances, aunts, uncles, cousins, random strangers or whatever. Just don't add additional siblings (unless of course Ryan's mom gives birth to a new baby, which is unlikely since she really doesn't want any more kids).

Don't be afraid to add! The story isn't going to write itself you know...
